content.raw: I see that topic listed, but I haven't tested it. I know the `arm_trajectory` topics are working, so perhaps you could use MoveIt! to do planning for the arm if the `hand_trajectory` doesn't work?

content.html: I'm downgrading the priority of this issue for our own book keeping efforts.

issue.title: Orientation does not work in topic /ihmc_ros/valkyrie/control/hand_trajectory

content.raw:
I don't understand why this isn't a blocker.

To Steven: Competitors have asked about creating their own controller instead of using the one from IHMC. They've been told no. IMO your suggest is to create our own controller for the arm and hand albeit using MoveIt. Seems contradictory.
content.html:
I don't understand why this isn't a blocker.

To Steven: Competitors have asked about creating their own controller instead of using the one from IHMC. They've been told no. IMO your suggest is to create our own controller for the arm and hand albeit using MoveIt. Seems contradictory.

issue.title: Orientation does not work in topic /ihmc_ros/valkyrie/control/hand_trajectory

content.raw:
Teams have been instructed that they must use the IHMC walking controller. Using moveit is not contradictory.

As stated, the downgrading is for our book keeping. This issue hasn't been removed, but we have to prioritize the issues.
content.html:
Teams have been instructed that they must use the IHMC walking controller. Using moveit is not contradictory.

As stated, the downgrading is for our book keeping. This issue hasn't been removed, but we have to prioritize the issues.

issue.title: Orientation does not work in topic /ihmc_ros/valkyrie/control/hand_trajectory
Orientation does not work in topic /ihmc_ros/valkyrie/control/hand_trajectory

content.html:
@nkoenig

Hi Nathan, just a quick question. I am trying to use the hand trajectory controller, but I am struggling with the position feedback. Exactly which point of the hand is going to be aligned to (x,y,z) position when I append this position to the hand trajectory list? Is it a point between the rightWristRollLink frame and the rightPalm frames? Is there any way of accessing the position values of this point?

Thanks a lot! We are a little stuck on this one.

issue.title: Orientation does not work in topic /ihmc_ros/valkyrie/control/hand_trajectory

content.raw: Does anyone happen know which frame gets aligned to position when using the hand trajectory message? Thanks!
content.html: Does anyone happen know which frame gets aligned to position when using the hand trajectory message? Thanks!

content.html: @rmerriam , @pista999, is this still an issue since the grasping controller has been released?

issue.title: Orientation does not work in topic /ihmc_ros/valkyrie/control/hand_trajectory

content.raw:
This is still an issue. I"m doing some testing and the orientation may be working but glacially slow in responding. This is not the same as the grasping capability. If you want to put the hand at the top of the wheel with the palm horizontal the grasp capability doesn't help with this. 

The location is not in good shape, either. 

I still object a bit to the suggestion made above that using MoveIt or equivalent is _not_ making us create our own controller versus using an IHMC controller. 

Given the time in the competition it's probably useless to expect this to be fixed so having registered my complaint I'll say you may as well mark this a "won't fix".
content.html:
This is still an issue. I"m doing some testing and the orientation may be working but glacially slow in responding. This is not the same as the grasping capability. If you want to put the hand at the top of the wheel with the palm horizontal the grasp capability doesn't help with this.

The location is not in good shape, either.

I still object a bit to the suggestion made above that using MoveIt or equivalent is not making us create our own controller versus using an IHMC controller.

Given the time in the competition it's probably useless to expect this to be fixed so having registered my complaint I'll say you may as well mark this a "won't fix".
